attributes.action: The people demand to know how our local MP voted regarding the  article50 treaty
attributes.additional_details: high court rules that due process should be applied before the triggering of artiicle 50. Forcing the Prime minister to put the agreements made regarding leaving the EU before the House for vote. which could delayed a democratic vote made by the people!!
attributes.background: The recent high court ruling forcing the house of parliament to have a vote regarding activation of article 50,  We the people demand to have the vote and votee's registered and published so if at anytime the people feel it is against public opinion they can voice there concerns in the ballot box

rejection.details:
We're not sure what action you would like the House of Commons to take. 

The only time that secret ballots are used in the House of Commons is for the election of certain office holders, such as the Speaker. The results of all other votes are published. You can find the results of any vote, including the names of MPs who took part and how they voted, in Hansard: https://hansard.parliament.uk/

There is also a new app which will show how MPs have voted:

https://www.parliament.uk/business/news/2016/november/mobile-app-for-vote-results-launched/

We're therefore not sure what you would like to change.
